Welcome to Pyicoteo¶

Pyicoteo* is a suite of tools for the analysis of high-throughput sequencing data. It works with genomic coordinates, it was mainly developed using Solexa/Illumina mapped reads, but in its core it is platform-agnostic. There are currently 6 different tools for the analysis of HTS data: 5 command-line based tools, which are: Pyicos for genomic coordinates manipulation, Pyicoller for peak calling on punctuated ChIP-Seq, Pyicoenrich for differential enrichment between two conditions, Pyicoclip for calling CLIP-Seq peaks without a control, Pyicoregion for generating exploratory regions automatically.

Pyicoteo suite also includes one configuration file based and a python library for scripting using HTS data:

Before start using it, it is highly recommended that you have a look at the Getting Started document:

* Pronounced as in Spanish  "picoteo"_ /pɪkɒtɛɒ/:
  (n) Appetizer-type foods that accompany drinks before or instead of a meal.
